argument.description: Specifies whether characters are removed from the beginning, the end, or from both ends of the string expression.
A single-character constant that specifies the character that is to be removed.

description: The TRIM function removes blanks or another specified character from the end, the beginning, or both ends of a string expression.
sample:
SELECT TRIM(:HELLO),
     TRIM(TRAILING FROM :HELLO)
   FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1
